subject: Science
title: Plastic Pollution
description: A short lesson to help you apply Plastic Pollution.

hook.text: Eight million tons of plastic enter the ocean every year. That's a garbage truck every minute.

buildup.text: Plastic doesn't biodegrade. It breaks into smaller and smaller pieces called microplastics.

discovery.text: Microplastics have been found in Arctic ice, deep-sea sediments, and human blood.

twist.text: Sea turtles mistake plastic bags for jellyfish. Seabirds feed bottle caps to their chicks.

climax.text: By 2050, there may be more plastic in the ocean by weight than fish.

punchline.text: Plastic lasts 500 years in the ocean. Every piece ever made still exists.

quiz.question: How much plastic enters the ocean each year?
